latexInstructions:
Solve analytically for $x$ in the next equation and express it in terms of mathematical constants:
$$x \ln x = 1$$
latexProof: $$x \ln x = 1 \\ \text{CHANGE OF VARIABLE} \\ u = \ln x \Longleftrightarrow x = e^u \\ \text{APPLY CHANGE} \\ e^u \ln (e^u) = 1 \\ u \cdot e^u \ln e = 1 \\ ue^u = 1 \\ W(ue^u)= W(1) \\ u = W(1) = \Omega \\ \text{REVERT TO VARIABLE CHANGE} \\ \Omega = \ln x \\ x = e^\Omega \\ \text{APPLY LAMBERT W DIVISION IDENTITY} \\ e^{W(z)} = \frac{z}{W(z)} \\ e^{W(1)} = \frac{1}{W(1)} \\ e^\Omega = \frac{1}{\Omega} \\ \boxed{x = \Omega^{-1}} = e^{\Omega} \approx 1.763222834$$
